properties.areaDesc: Transylvania, NC; Greenville, SC; Pickens, SC; Henderson, NC; Oconee, SC; Anderson, SC
properties.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 13 at 7:28AM EST until February 13 at 8:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a

* Severe Thunderstorm Warning for...
Southeastern Transylvania County in western North Carolina...
Southeastern Henderson County in western North Carolina...
Northwestern Greenville County in Upstate South Carolina...
Northwestern Anderson County in Upstate South Carolina...
Pickens County in Upstate South Carolina...
Eastern Oconee County in Upstate South Carolina...

* Until 800 AM EST.

* At 727 AM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line
extending from 11 miles southwest of Brevard to 4 miles east of
Walhalla to 9 miles east of Toccoa, moving northeast at 65 mph.

HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines.

* Locations impacted include...
Easley, Clemson, Seneca, Walhalla, Pickens, Travelers Rest,
Central, Pendleton, Liberty and Flat Rock.
properties.instruction:
Conditions are favorable for the development of brief, weak
tornadoes. Seek shelter inside an interior room.

Lake Keowee and Lake Hartwell are is in the path of these storms.
Get away from the water and seek shelter in an interior room in the
nearest shelter. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be
struck by lightning.

Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National
Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800,
2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using
hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the
specific location where it occurred.
